conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a non-fiction movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
It sounds like you're looking for a non-fiction film! If you're interested in a compelling tale based on real events, I'd highly recommend "A Time to Kill." This movie is set in the 1960s deep south and follows a young lawyer as he defends a black man accused of murdering two white men who raped his daughter. It's an intense, thought-provoking film that's sure to keep you engaged.

If you fancy something a bit lighter, "The Secret of My Success" starring Michael J. Fox might be more up your alley. This comedy follows a young man rising through the ranks of corporate America in the 1980s, facing various challenges and romantic entanglements along the way. It's a fun, entertaining watch!

This period drama follows the March sisters in post-Civil War America and features a talented cast. Additionally, if you're interested in a modern sci-fi thriller, 'Paycheck' starring Ben Affleck could be an engaging watch for you too!

Both movies offer intricate plots and powerful performances that might appeal to you.
